meanings.definition: Relating to or resembling a shadow or darkness.
meanings.sent1: The room had an umbral atmosphere, with dim lights and heavy curtains.
meanings.sent2: The forest became umbral as the sun set behind the mountains.
meanings.sent3: The umbral corners of the attic seemed to hide secrets and mysteries.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were umbral, clouded by doubt and uncertainty.
meanings.sent5: The umbral figure in the painting loomed ominously over the room.

meanings.definition: The fully shaded inner region of a shadow cast by an opaque object.
meanings.sent1: She found solace in the umbral coolness of the cave on a hot day.
meanings.sent2: The umbral of the tree provided a perfect spot for a picnic away from the sun.
meanings.sent3: The cat napped peacefully in the umbral of the window, away from the bright sunlight.
meanings.sent4: The umbral of the building offered a welcome respite from the scorching heat outside.
meanings.sent5: The umbral of the umbrella shielded her from the rain as she walked home.
